title.narrative: Citizen Engagement for Social Service Delivery III

description.narrative: The Citizen Engagement for Social Service Delivery Project (CESSD Phase III) aims to improve the delivery of existing education, health, and rural water supply services in 11 (of 24) districts in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province by providing training and technical assistance to the Government of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, district governments and community-based organisations. CESSD Phase III builds the capacity of community-based organisations such as Parent Teacher Councils, Primary Care Management Committees and Water User Committees to support and exercise oversight of the management of primary schools, basic health units and rural water supply schemes. The CESSD project was initiated by the Canadian International Development Agency (CIDA) and co-funded by AusAID during Phase II and III. Australia's support to CESSD has contributed to improvements in the quality of services, for example between 2010 and 2012: patients consulting health facilities increased by 149 per cent; teacher absenteeism
